PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Human body is a __________________ machine.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) wonderful

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Trunk and __________________ are external parts of our body.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) neck

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We can click the photos with our __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) hands

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We taste different types of avours with our __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) nose

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Tongue also helps us to __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) speak

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What are external and internal parts of our body?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Our head, neck, trunk, two arms and two legs are the external parts of our body. Internal parts of human body are those which we cannot see, such as brain, heart, lungs, stomach, etc.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is the role of eyes in our body?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Our eyes are the sense of sight. They enable us to see everything around us. We can read books and watch movies.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Our hands are very important. What do they do?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: • We can write with our hands. • We can throw the ball with our hands • We can eat food with our hands. • We can click the photos with our hands.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How is our nose useful to us?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Our nose is the sense of smell_x0002_we smell various fragrances with it. It helps us to breathe. It sends messages to our brain that tell us whether a smell is pleasant or unpleasant.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What are two most important things we do with our tongue?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Two most important things we do with our tongue are : 1 Knowing About Human Body EVS-3 (i) We taste various flavours like banana, milk, burger, chocolates, etc. (ii) Our tongue also helps us to speak.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Which family has father, mother and their children?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) nuclear

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The __________________ love their children a lot.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) parents

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: A nuclear family is also called a __________________ family.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) small

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Most of us have free time on __________________ and other holidays.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) Sundays

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We can watch __________________ with our family.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) newspaper

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Explain the term ‘family’ briefly.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: A group of people who are related to one antoher and live together is known as a family.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How many members are there in a small nuclear family
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: A small nuclear family consists of father, mother and their one or two children.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Differentiate between a nuclear family and a joint family?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: The difference between nuclear family and joint family is that a nuclear family is one which consists of father, mother and their children, whereas a joint family is one which consists of father, mother, their children, grandparents, uncles, aunts and cousins.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is importance of parents in family?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Parents are very important in a family for the following reasons : (i) Parents love their children a lot. (ii) They spend time with children. (iii) They teach their children about sharing and caring. (iv) They provide all the facilities to the children. (v) They keep the house clean and maintain it. (vi) They care for the children. (vii)They take resposibility of all the financial matters.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do you mean by recreation at home?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: The activities which we do with our family to relax and enjoy ourselves on Sundays and other holidays is recreation at home. e.g. watching television with family, playing indoor games with siblings and going on vacations with the family.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The old people are usually not __________________ enough.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) strong

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Often many people become __________________ due to illness.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) sick

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The ________________ people may not be able to see, hear or walk properly.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) old

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Why are some old people unable to see, hear and walk?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Some old people are not able to see, hear and walk because they are not strong enough. Their body becomes weak due to old age.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What are the nursing homes?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Nursing homes are those places where elderly people stay, depending on the kind of care they need.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How are physically challenged people different from others?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Physically handicapped people possess special characteristics. Some of them cannot see, some can't hear, some can't walk or speak. Some of them don't understand anything. They live and do the things that we do but in a different way. e.g. Blind people use Braille for reading.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Briefly explain Braille script.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Braille script is a kind of special writing with raised dots. It is used by the blind people for reading. They feel the raised letters with the help of their fingers on the paper and read.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do we see around us?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) plants

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Leaves are a source of __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) oxygen

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: A tree has a __________________ brown stem called a trunk.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) thick

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Leaves are known as the food making factories of __________________plants.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) green

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Creepers spread horizontally along the __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) soil

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Define the term trees.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Very big and strong plants are known as trees.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do you mean by aquatic plants?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Aquatic plants are those plants which are adapted to grow in water. e.g. lotus and hydrilla.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Give an example of: creeper, herb and shrub.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Creeper - Pumpkins , Herb - Mint, Shrub - Jasmine

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is photosynthesis?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: The method used by green plants to make their food using sunlight is known as photosynthesis.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Write two uses of leaves.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Two uses of leaves are : (a) They are a source of oxygen_x0002_Oxygen is produced through transpiration. (b) They also help to prepare disposable food containers.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We see animals all over the __________________.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) world

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Wild animals live in __________________.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) jungles

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Most farm animals are __________________ animals.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) domestic

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We should not __________________ the animals.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) tease

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: An owl lives on a __________________.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) hole in a tree

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Dene wild animals.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Wild animals are those animals which live in jungles. e.g. tigers, zebras etc.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Write about domestic animals.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Domestic animals are those animals whom we keep in our homes. They are also known as pet animals or tamed animals. e.g. dogs, cats, parrots, cows, goats etc.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Where do animals live?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Different animals live at different places. Wild animals live in jungles. Farm animals live in farms. Pet animals live in the homes of human beings. Some animals live on land, some in water, and some live on the trees.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Give differences between herbivorous and carnivorous animals.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Difference between herbivorous and carnivorous animals is that the herbivorous animals eat only 6 World of Animals plants, grasses, leaves etc. e.g. deers and horses, whereas carnivorous animals eat only jlesh of other animals e.g. lings and snakes animals.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How do certain animals make movement?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Animals move in different ways because they have various kinds of bodies e.g. Dogs and tigers run and walk on four legs. Snakes and tortoise crawl on earth and fishes and crabs swim in water using their fins and legs.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Insects are __________________ animals.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) small

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Birds cannot bite or chew their food because they have no ________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) teeth

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The __________________ prepares honey from the pollen of flowers.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) honeybees

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Insects feel and smell with __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) feelers

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: A tailor bird __________________ leaves to makes its nest.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) sews

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Write the names of different types of birds around us.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Different types of birds around us include parrots, sparrows, crows, pigeons, peacocks, ducks etc.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is the colour of the beetles? How are their front wings useful to them?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Beetles can be brown or black in colour. Their front wings change into a hard shell to protect the back wings.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Describe about cockroaches and mosquitoes.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Cockroaches move in and out of drains and carry a lot of dirt. Mosquitoes breed in standing water and swamps. They feed on blood. Denque-fever carrying mosquitoes bite during the day.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Dene the term- social insects?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Social insects are those insects who exhibit social behaviours, such as aggregating in large numbers at time. e.g. bees, wasps and ants.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How are social insects useful for human beings?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Social insects are useful for the human beings in the following ways : (i) Honeybees provide us honey. (ii) We get silk from silkworms.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: All of us eat food everyday to stay ___________.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) alive

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: __________________ foods is of no use to us.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) junk

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: People doing physical work need more __________________ foods.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) energy-giving

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: A diet which does not contain sufficient __________________ can lead to many different health issues.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) nutrients

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: __________________ is the last meal of the day.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) Dinner

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: List different types of foods that we eat.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Different types of food that we eat are : (i) Energy- giving foods (a) with starch-rice, potato, wheat, sugar etc. (b) with fat- butter, ghee, eggs etc. (ii) Body - building foods - pulses, meat, fish, milk and milk products etc. (iii) Protective foods - fruits, vegetables, nuts, green leagy vegetables etc.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Define the role of fruits and vegetables for us?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Fruits and vegetables are protective foods. They keep us safe from infections and diseases. They also keep us healthy and strong.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is the difference between energy-giving and body-building foods?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Energy - giving foods provide us energy to work and play. Body - building foods help us to grow. They make our muscles and blood and help the wounds to heal faster.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Define the term balanced diet?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Balanced diet is one which contains the right amount of proteins, carbohydrates, fats, fibres, vitamins and minerals.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Why should we avoid junk foods?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: We should avoid junk food becauses they are of no use to us. They can harm our body and teeth. They do not have any nutrients.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The broken shoes are mended by a __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) cobbler

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: A postman wears __________________ uniform.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) Khaki

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The __________________ cleans the streets outside our houses.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) sweeper

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The doctors treat patients in the __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) hospital

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: A postman brings __________________ and parcels for us.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) letters

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do you mean by an occupation?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Occupation refers to any work done for earning money.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: List any ve people who work outside for us.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Five people who work outside for us are - washerman, barber farmers, carpenters and cobbler.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Who delivers fruits and vegetables at our doorstep?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: The greengrocer delivers fruits and vegetables at our doorstep.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How does a greengrocer sell his vegetables?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: A greengracer sells his vegetables by pushing his cart of fruits and vegetables from one place to another.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Dene the term child labour?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Many children from poor families work in homes, factories, farms etc. to earn money. Sometimes, they pick rags, or make glass bangles or sells items on the streets. They work and live in unhealthy places. This is called child labour.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Air also contains __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) dust particles

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We should __________________ trees.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) plant

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Pollution inside homes is known as __________________ air pollution.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) in door

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Smoking cigarettes and ________________ can be very dangerous for health.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) tobacco

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We should avoid bursting too many ________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) crackers

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Write the importance of air.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: All living beings need air to live. They can survive without food for a few weeks and without water for a few days. But, they cannot live without air for more than a few minutes.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do you mean by air?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Air is a mixture of gases such as nitrogen, oxygen and carbon-di-oxide. Nitrogen gas forms most of the air.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is air pollution?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Air which contains lot of dust is harmful for us. It also contains smoke and poisonous gases. They make the air dirty. This is called air pollution.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How can we prevent air pollution?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: We can prevent air pollution by  keeping our surroundings, and the air around us clean. All factory and vehicle owners must make sure that they do not pollute the air.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is outdoor air pollution? Write some examples.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Outdoor pollution is caused by the burning of coal, oil and gas in power stations, industries, homes and vehicles. Outdoor pollution can also be caused by oxides of sulphur and nitrogen from volcanoes, oceans, biological decay, lightning and forest fires.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: All __________________ need water to live.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) living beings

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Water exists in __________________ forms.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) three

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The water vapour rises into the __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) air

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: __________________ is the key source of water on the Earth.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) rainwater

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: The water in our taps can be made safe for drinking by __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) boiling

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Why is water important to us?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: All living beings need water to live. It is precious for all. We drink a lot of water everyday. It helps us to stay healthy. We also need water for cooking, bathing, washing cleaning and other purposes.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: In how many forms does the water exist?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Water exists in three forms : solid, liquid and gas. Ice and 13 Water is Precious snow are solid state of water. The usual form of water is liquid. It evaporates to turn into gas.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is water cycle? Explain it with a neat diagram.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: When the sun shines on the water in rivers, seas, lakes, etc; it gets heated and turns into vapour. After this, water vapour rises into the air, where they gather as clouds. When the clouds become cool, the water vapour again turns into water and falls as rain on the Earth. This rainwater flows back into the springs, streams, rivers, lakes and the seas; and the cycle begins all over again. This whole process is called water cycle.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is surface water?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: A large amount of rainwater flows into ponds, lakes and rivers. This is called the surface water.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How do villagers store water?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Villagers store water in earthen pots and containers made of metals like copper or brass.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Transport has mainly __________________ forms.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) three

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We can also travel to short distances by __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) bicycles

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Most people use public transport for __________________ journeys.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) short
(b) tracks

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is the need of travel?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Travelling is needed for meeting friends or relatives living in various parts of the country or abroad. People also travel within the city, to other cities of the country, or to a foreign country for the purpose of work or recreation.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do you understand by air transports?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Air transport involves travelling or carrying of goods from one place to another through the route of air. Aeroplanes are the most common means of air transport.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is the difference between water transport and land transport?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: In water transport, rivers, seas, lakes, or Oceans are used to go from one place to another. In this, we travel in a ship, or various kinds of boats. Land transport uses roads and railway tracks for travelling. Road transport includes bicycles, two three and four wheeler vehicles, buses, trams 14 Means of Transport etc. Rails and Metro Rails run on railway tracks.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How are animals used as means of transports?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Donkeys are used to carry materials at short distances. Horses and bullock carts are used to transport people and goods. Camels carry people and goods in Rajasthan and Gujarat. Elephants ferry people in Kerala and Assam.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: __________________ was invented by Alexander Graham Bell.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) Telephone

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Earlier people used __________________ to send and receive letters.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) pigeons

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We can talk to friends while sitting at home by __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) telephone

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Radio and television are the means of __________________ media.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) electronic

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Which is the latest wonder of communication?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) internet

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Dene the term communication?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Communication refers to expressing our thoughts to other people, and understanding their thoughts. e.g. letters, telephone etc.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is the full form of PIN?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: The full form of PIN is Postal Index Number.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is the fastest means of communication?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Telephone is the fastest means of electronic communication.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What are the benets of mobile phones or cellular phones?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: The benefit of a mobile phone is that it is wireless, so, we can carry it anywhere. We can receive or dial calls through mobile phones while travelling also. We can send text and picture messages through it.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do you mean by mass communication?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Communicating with a large number or mass of people at the same time is known as mass communication.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: East, West, North and South are four key __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) directions

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: __________________ is always towards the top of the map.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) North

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: A book containing map is called an __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) atlas

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Every map shows__________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) scale

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Open level land spaces are often coloured __________________ in maps.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) green

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Write the four main directions.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: The four main directions are - North, South, East and West.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Dene the landmarks.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Landmark refers to a or a thing like a school, bank, etc. with the help of which one can recognize a place easily.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How are the direction words helpful?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: The knowledge of directions is essential for finding any place. It is difficult to reach a new place without the knowledge of 16 Knowing About Directions proper directions.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do you mean by scale of a map?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: It is not possible to show the exact distance on a map. A distance of 200 km. May be shown by 2 cm on a map.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Which colour is used to show open land spaces in a map?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Open level land spaces are often coloured green in maps.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What keeps our mind fresh and active ?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) recreation

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Games and sports are the most common forms of recreational ____________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) activities

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We play __________________ inside the home.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) chess

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Dancing is not only relaxing but also a __________________ exercise.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) good

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We should not __________________ the music loudly.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) hear

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What do you mean by recreation?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Recreation means enjoying and relaxing when you are not working. It is one of the most effective tool for keeping ourselves fresh and energetic.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How do you enjoy recreation with your family?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Recreation means enjoying and relaxing when you are not working. It is one of the most effective tool for keeping ourselves fresh and energetic.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Which types of games are played inside the house?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Recreation means enjoying and relaxing when you are not working. It is one of the most effective tool for keeping ourselves fresh and energetic.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Which types of game are played outside the house?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Recreation means enjoying and relaxing when you are not working. It is one of the most effective tool for keeping ourselves fresh and energetic.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Mention briefly about other recreational activities at home.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Recreation means enjoying and relaxing when you are not working. It is one of the most effective tool for keeping ourselves fresh and energetic.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Taking care of our __________________ is a key activity of our life.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) body

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We should brush our teeth __________________ a day.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) twice

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: When our hair needs a cut, we should go the __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (b) barber

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is a key activity of our life?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Taking care of our body is a key activity of our life.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How can we take care of our teeth?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: We can take care of our teeth by brushing them twice a day. We should rinse our mouth with water to get rid of good stuck to our teeth.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: When should we clean our hands?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: We should clean our hands after playing, eating, using the bathroom, blowing our nose, coughing, sneezing, touching animals, touching garbage, and ater doing outdoor activities.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Write a short note on remaining fit and well.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: To remain fit and well, we must exercise everyday. Exercise helps our body to grow strong and healthy. We should sleep for at least eight hours everyday. We should also play outdoor games regularly. This will help us to stay active throughout the day.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: How can Yoga keeps us active and healthy?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Yoga keeps us healthy and fit by increasing the flexibility of the body, by improving the strength of the body and by making our mind free from stress.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We brush our teeth before going to bed. Why?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: We brush our teeth before going to bed because whatever we eat during the day, gets stuck in our teeth. It is necessary to remove this tartar before going to bed so that our teeth remain clean and healthy

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Gypsy __________________ live in a caravan.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) people

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Houseboats are very common in __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (e) Kashmir

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: A tent is a house made of special cloth called __________________ .
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) canvas

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: An__________________ is made of snow.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) igloo

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We should keep things in their __________________ places.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) proper

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Dene a house.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: A house is our shelter. It keeps us safe from heat, cold, wind, thieves and wild animals. We get rest, peace, comfort and happiness in our houses.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is a pucca house?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Pucca houses are permanent houses made from bricks, stones, cement, and even iron, steel and glass. These houses are very strong.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What is a carvan?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Caravans are mobile houses on wheels. They can be moved from one place to another by animals or by a car. Gypsy people live in these houses.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Write two steps of keeping house clean?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: For keeping the house clean, the following things should be kept in mind :  • Keep things in their proper places. • The houses should be kept clean by sweeping and mopping it everyday. • All articles such as furniture should be dusted daily. • Keep the kitchen clean and free from insects. It should have a chimney or exhaust to drive away any smoke.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: When do we decorate our home?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: We decorate our home on Diwali by making Rangoli and lighting diyas. We also decorate our home when we buy a new home or on occasions such as birthdays etc.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We drink water on feeling ___________.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (c) thirsty

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: We must drink _____________ glasses of water everyday.
Plants suck water from soil through their ____________.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) roots

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Making water dirty is called __________ pollution.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (d) water

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Clean water is supplied to our homes by __________.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: (a) Jal Boards

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Dene water.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Water is colourless, odourless and tasteless liquid. All living beings need water to live.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: What are the uses of water?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Uses of water are : (i) At home - to bathe, clean, cook, wash, drink etc. (ii) At farms - to grow crops. (iii) For electricity - to generate electricity.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Mention steps to save water in our daily life.
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Ways in which we can save water are : (i) take bath with the help of bucket and mug instead of shower. 12 Importance of Water (ii) close the tap when not in use. (iii) Repair leaking taps and pipes. (iv) Don't overuse water.

PR_QUESTIONS.PR_QUESTION: Why do plants and animals need water?
PR_QUESTIONS.PR_ANSWER: Plants and animals need water to live. Plants use water to make their food. The organs of the animals function when they get enought water. They also need water for other functions such as bathing etc. Aquatic animals live only in water.
